name: Begonia bipinnatifida
description: Begonia bipinnatifida is a terrestrial plant native to tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Begoniaceae family and features upright stems (20-40 cm tall) with small, asymmetrical, deeply divided (bipinnatifid), dark green leaves with distinctive, fern-like appearance. The plant displays an upright, bushy growth habit. Leaves often feature striking patterns including spirals, spots, stripes, and iridescent sheens, with some species having translucent "windows" in their leaves. Thrives in the humid, shaded understory of tropical forests where it receives consistent moisture and protection from direct sunlight. In its native habitat, it grows in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive fern-like foliage. It's popular among Begonia enthusiasts for its unique leaf shape.
careTips: Keep soil moist but not soggy
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
